sources.title: Under Western Stars
sources.description: Roy Rogers plays the son of a late Congressman who fought on behalf of the small ranchers who are being starved out because of the dam the water power company has built and the exorbitant rates being charged. This was the first Movie that Leonard Sly starred in as Roy Rogers

sources.title: Under Western Stars (1938) Roy Rogers | Action, Adventure, Music
sources.description:
A NEW WESTERN STAR BLAZES HIS WAY ACROSS THE SCREEN!  Roy is elected to Congress to bring the misery of the "dustbowl" of the 1930s to the attention of Washington politicians.

Director: Joseph Kane
Writers: Dorrell McGowan, Stuart E. McGowan 
Stars: Roy Rogers, Smiley Burnette, Carol Hughes 
Genres: Classics, Action, Adventure, Music, Western 

@CCC socials:
https://www.facebook.com/CultCinemaClassics 
https://www.instagram.com/cultcinemaclassics
https://www.twitch.tv/cultcinemaclassics

metadata.Plot: In his starring debut Roy gets elected to congress in order to bring water to the ranchers in his district. In Washington he learns he needs the backing of a key congressman and gets that man to go west for an inspection trip. When the Congressman is initally unimpressed, Roy gets the inspection party stranded without water to show the true conditions.
metadata.Writer: Dorrell McGowan, Stuart E. McGowan, Betty Burbridge
metadata.Actors: Roy Rogers, Smiley Burnette, Carol Hughes
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 1 win & 1 nomination total
